definitions.definition: A close-range shot in which the shooter banks the ball off the backboard from a few feet away.

definitions.example: Meeting the numbers will be a layup, if not a slam dunk.

definitions.definition: The state of being laid up.
definitions.example: The ship endured an interminable layup in the harbor lasting nearly a month.

definitions.definition: A track used to store train cars.
definitions.example: The caboose, long decrepit, rested on a forgotten layup just north of the dry riverbed.

definitions.definition: A train car sitting in storage (laid up), often overnight.
definitions.example: Though I knew we shouldn't be there, she pulled me out of the tunnel and into the dark layup, its floors still grubby from the morning commute many hours ago.

definitions.definition: The process of applying alternate layers of a material and a binding agent to form a composite material.
definitions.example: Forgetting to clear the sawdust around his workshop, Payton ended up contaminating the resin-ply matrix with wood particles during his hand layup.
